item.title: Write Functions In Functional Programming Style In Scala
item.description: When you write programs in a functional style it is a requirement that you use pure functions. To begin understanding the concept of pure functions we first need to understand what referential transparency is. An expression satisfies referential transparency if its result can replace it and program behavior does not change in any way. This replacement does not depend on context so it must hold wherever substitution happens in the program.
